timer

Class Timer

  • java.lang.Object
    • timer.Timer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameTimer

    public abstract class Timer
extends java.lang.Object
    A abstract timer utility class, that supports pause and resume. Can be used either as a normal timer or a countdown timer.
    Author:
    Sridhar Sundar Raman

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DURATION_INFINITY 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Timer()
      Default constructor which sets the interval to 1000 ms (1s) and the duration to DURATION_INFINITY
      Timer(long interval, long duration) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancel()
      Stops the timer.
      long getElapsedTime() 
      long getRemainingTime() 
      boolean isRunning() 
      void pause()
      Paused the timer.
      void resume()
      Resumes the timer if it was paused, else starts the timer.
      void start()
      Starts the timer.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • DURATION_INFINITY

        public static final int DURATION_INFINITY
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Timer

        public Timer()
        Default constructor which sets the interval to 1000 ms (1s) and the duration to DURATION_INFINITY

      • Timer

        public Timer(long interval,
             long duration)
        Parameters:
        interval - The time gap between each tick in millis.
        duration - The period in millis for which the timer should run. Set it to Timer#DURATION_INFINITY if the timer has to run indefinitely.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the timer. If the timer was already running, this call is ignored.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Paused the timer. If the timer is not running, this call is ignored.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resumes the timer if it was paused, else starts the timer.

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Stops the timer. If the timer is not running, then this call does nothing.

      • getElapsedTime

        public long getElapsedTime()
        Returns:
        the elapsed time (in millis) since the start of the timer.

      • getRemainingTime

        public long getRemainingTime()
        Returns:
        the time remaining (in millis) for the timer to stop. If the duration was set to Timer#DURATION_INFINITY, then -1 is returned.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns:
        true if the timer is currently running, and false otherwise.
